page.title: 18WALKING STICKS LAMPLUGH
page.content: Making walking sticks is a Lakeland craft. Cyril Tyson has been making walking sticks for 53 years. His dad taught him the craft when he was 8. The wood has to dry out for 3 years which includes leaving it on a flat board and turning it to straighten it. The handles are made of Deer horn, Ram horn, Buffalo horn, Cow horn, Deer foot and Wood. The horns have to be boiled before they can be bent into shape. Each stick takes about 100 hours to make (Not including finding and drying the wood). The cost of the sticks is: Deer horn Â£12 Buffalo horn Â£70 and ornamental sticks are Â£100. Deer horn before it is made into a stick costs Â£3.50 per 100g. Cyril Tyson gives quite a lot of his sticks as prizes for raffles.
